Package Everything

Class FileHandler

java.lang.Object
Everything.FileHandler
public class FileHandler extends Object
Used to get election information from a given input file, and to output information to audit/report files Written by Jasper Rutherford

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    FileHandler()
    creates a default FileHandler which has no files to draw input from.

  • Constructor Details

    • FileHandler

      public FileHandler()
      creates a default FileHandler which has no files to draw input from.

  • Method Details

    • addFilename

      public void addFilename(String filename)
      blindly adds the given file to the list of filenames
      Parameters:
      filename - the filename to be added to this FileHandler's list of filenames

    • nextLine

      public String nextLine()
      gets the next line from the input file
      Returns:
      a string representing the next line from the input file

    • nextInt

      public int nextInt()
      reads in the next line of input and returns the first number found in that line This is expected to work as such:

      if the file is: " 4 5 6 7 8 9 1 2 " and nextInt() is called 5 times, it should return 4, 6, 7, 8, 2

      Returns:
      an int representing the first number found on the next line

    • close

      public void close()
      closes all the files

    • auditLog

      public void auditLog(String log)
      records the provided string to the audit file
      Parameters:
      log - the string to record to the audit file

    • reportLog

      public void reportLog(String log)
      records the provided string to the report file
      Parameters:
      log - the string to record to the report file

    • invalidBallotLog

      public void invalidBallotLog(String log)
      records the provided string to the invalidBallots file
      Parameters:
      log - the string to record to the invalidBallots file

    • nextInputFile

      public boolean nextInputFile()
      Advances the FileHandler's Scanner to the next file in the list
      Returns:
      true if a file was successfully opened, false otherwise

    • getNumFilenames

      public int getNumFilenames()
      Gets the number of filenames that are currently stored in this FileHandler object
      Returns:
      an int equal to filenames.size()

    • getFilenames

      public ArrayList<String> getFilenames()
      Gets a list of all filenames currently stored in this FileHandler object
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of Strings representing all filenames currently stored in this FileHandler object
